trans-unit.target: This article describes how to create a 3-node Deis cluster on Azure using an Azure Resource Manager template

trans-unit.source: Deploy a 3-node Deis cluster
trans-unit.target: Deploy a 3-node Deis cluster

trans-unit.source: This article walks you through provisioning a [Deis](http://deis.io/) cluster on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This article walks you through provisioning a [Deis](http://deis.io/) cluster on Azure.

trans-unit.source: It covers all the steps from creating the necessary certificates to deploying and scaling a sample **Go** application on the newly provisioned cluster.
trans-unit.target: It covers all the steps from creating the necessary certificates to deploying and scaling a sample **Go** application on the newly provisioned cluster.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram shows the architecture of the deployed system.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows the architecture of the deployed system.

trans-unit.source: A system administrator manages the cluster using Deis tools such as **deis** and **deisctl**.
trans-unit.target: A system administrator manages the cluster using Deis tools such as **deis** and **deisctl**.

trans-unit.source: Connections are established through an Azure load balancer, which forwards the connections to one of the member nodes on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Connections are established through an Azure load balancer, which forwards the connections to one of the member nodes on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The clients access deployed applications through the load balancer as well.
trans-unit.target: The clients access deployed applications through the load balancer as well.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the load balancer forwards the traffic to a Deis router mesh, which further routs traffic to corresponding Docker containers hosted on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the load balancer forwards the traffic to a Deis router mesh, which further routs traffic to corresponding Docker containers hosted on the cluster.
